overview_of_class: This is a continuation of Real Analysis sequence. Rigorous analysis in Euclidean space, beginning with one and proceeding to several variables. Properties of the real numbers, limits and continuity, differentiation and integration, sequences and series, the inverse and implicit function theorems. Applications to Fourier series. Primarily for undergraduates; open to graduate students only with departmental consent. Students may not receive credit for both 320-1 and 321-1 or both 320-2 and 321-2. Prerequisite: 234, 240, 300; or 291-1,2,3; or consent of instructor.
name: Real Analysis
subject: MATH
